runs.comm: full ball outside off, slight shape, left alone
we are rolling already. Short of a length, slight extra bounce on the punch, takes a thick edge for four past second slip
this time he defends the shortish delivery outside off
short of a length, wide, punched away, straight to cover
asking for trouble. Got away with the two earlier short ones, but this time Amla gets on top of the bounce, and misses the man at cover with this punch shot
short of a length, angling in, defended to leg this time, but he has overstepped

ohhhh. That's a nasty nasty beamer. These are the kinds that can end tournaments for batsmen. This is no slower ball or anything. A wild full toss that follows him and gets him on the right wrist. Immediate apology and concern shown by UAE players
full ball just outside off, Amla swings, gets an edge, is caught at first slip. So a dot ball on the free hit
length ball, on the pads, worked to leg for one
wide on the crease, full, outside off, pushed to mid-off
on a length, just outside off, defended
wide length ball, driven on the up, through extra cover. Third four already
short of a length, wide, he finds cover with the punch
punched away again, finds cover again
on a length, on off, he looks to drop and run, but has pushed it too sweetly to cover
wide length ball, left alone. It's a no-ball
clears the front leg to hit hard, gets a bottom edge for a single to fine leg
short of a length, angling in, defended to mid-on
stays back to a length ball, defends it to cover
Amla is out. Looking to force the pace. Looks to pull, the ball is not short enough, the top edge goes straight up in the air. Easy catch
full ball, driven to mid-on
a length ball, outside leg, worked away off the pads for a single
bouncer, de Kock mis-hits, Rossouw wants a single to square leg, but de Kock doesn't want to run. This is Rossouw's call. Not a great response from de Kock
short of a length, angling away, punched to point
short of a length, tucked away off the hip for a single
full, on off, pushed to mid-off
short, pulled away from just outside off, gets four through midwicket. All along the ground

this is poor running from de Kock. Once again refuses to run when the ball has gone behind square. Short of a length, pitched clearly outside leg, hits his pad, and de Kock is more interested in the appeal. This is the second time he has turned down a single
cut away past point, but not sweetly timed
pushes at a length ball away from the body, gets an inside edge onto the pad, and this time he does well by running off for a single although the ball has trickled along to cover
short again, and Rossouw pulls another four through midwicket. He is a good puller
fuller, just outside off, defended to cover
on a length, middle and off, no room, takes the inside edge for a single
on a length, just outside off, driven on the up, but finds the fielder at cover
short of a length, outside off, defended with an open face
short of a length, on the pads, tucked away into the leg side where two misfields - at short midwicket and mid-on - allow them a couple
full and straight, driven back into the pitch, and it bounced back over the bowler's head for four
low full toss, just hitting practice for Rossouw. Driven to the right of the stumps at the non-striker's end
oh nearly another boundary. Pitches short this time, Rossouw drags this pull from outside off, but can't beat short midwicket
on a length, outside off, driven on the up, straight to point

De Kock seems to be on a mission to run Rossouw out. Twice he has refused to run when the call has been Rossouw's. Now he lays with soft hands, begins to run and then sends Rossouw back. No damage done, though
on a length, middle and leg, defended to leg
short of a length, outside off, steered away to third man
short of a length, punched away , but straight to cover-point
half-volley, on off, driven straight to mid-off
short, de Kock pulls, gets a single to long leg
short of a length, on off, punched down for four. To the right of mid-on
punched to mid-off this time
short at his pace is not on. Rossouw pulls this from outside off, and gets four through midwicket
fuller now, just outside off, left alone
short of a length, on off, defended from the crease
short, no room. Not sure if he can pull or cut. Ends up defending this back onto his own body
on a length, just outside off, defended to short cover
short, outside off. Rossouw would have pulled this away for four. De Kock is uncertain and gets a soft leading edge as he looks to turn this to leg
short of a length, defended
another mistimed cut, gets a single
on a length, just outside off, left alone
on a length, just outside off, defended to mid-on
De Kock finally gets one out of the middle of the bat. On a length, outside off, he drives with an open face through the crowded cover ring. This is de Kock's highest score this World Cup
full, on off, driven to mid-on
short outside leg, wide, and also a no-ball
full on the pads, clears the front leg, and slugs this away through midwicket
whipped away off the hip, but straight to square leg
short of a length, on off, defended back to him
looks to pull, gets a bottom edge onto the box, and even though he seems to be hit Rossouw responds to de Kock's call as the ball trickles towards point. Something to learn for de Kock
short of a length, on middle and off, punched to mid-on
short, pulled away straight of deep midwicket for a couple
short of a length, outside off, pushed straight to point
short of a length, wide, looks to cut, but changes his mind at the last moment, and sort of rolls his wrists. Beaten
short of a length, on off, drops this towards cover for a single
full, outside off, de Kock's timing is off as he inside-edges this back to Javed
wide down the leg side as he pitches this up
bat face turns again as he looks to drive. Straight back to the bowler
soft hands on a length ball outside off, and they steal a single to cover to bring up the fifty for this stand
pitched up outside off, left alone
on a length, middle and leg, pushed to mid-on
some swing into the pads but this starts outside leg, and they get a leg-bye
How has this missed?. On a length, just outside off, he plays for the turn, the ball doesn't turn, beats the inside edge, goes on with the angle, and misses the top of off by a whisker
this time he gets behind the line of the ball, and defends
no turn again, wide down the leg side
looks to drive as this is tossed up outside off, but the ball doesn't turn and takes his inside edge
and again he plays for the non-existent turn, and gets an inside edge
closer to off, and this time he gets right behind it
another forward-defensive to end the over
on the pads, clipped away for a single
full outside off, left alone
on a length, middle and leg, defended to mid-on
full, middle and leg, defended back to him
full, on off, defended to mid-off

he hasn't scored too many runs of late, and looks to manufacture a pull. The ball is not short enough, and gets a top edge towards third man. Kamran Shahzad dives too early, and jams his knee straight into the ground. Not only has he conceded two extra runs, he has hurt his knee. That's awful. He tries to slide, but comes out an awkward angle and the knee gets stuck in the ground. He is back up and fielding

another South African batsman plays for the turn, has his inside edge beaten, but this time the ball bounces over the stumps and goes for four byes. Tauqir not happy with his new keeper, Saqlain Haider
worked to leg for a single
full, outside off, pushed to the right of Tauqir, who puts in a dive to save one run
inside half of the bat again as he looks to drive. They are playing for the non-existent turn here
down the wicket to drive this to long-on for one
down the wicket, not quite to the pitch of the ball, defends this back to him
driven on the up, between point and cover-point for one
full outside off, driven to mid-off
short of a length, outside off, punched away to deep cover
on the pads, tucked away past midwicket for one
short of a length, dropped in front of square. Wants one but is sent back

huge appeal for a catch at the wicket and a pretty aggressive review as Steve Davis turns the appeal down. A bit of an offcutter, a length ball outside off, de Kock pushes away from the body, gets a big edge, which is registered on the Snicko. Easy to overturn this. Yet another successful review against Davis. On this form, you'd hope he doesn't make it to the quarters. Everybody was convinced this was out, and the replays proved that. Sound, deviation, snicko, everything agrees
flighted on middle and leg, defended to mid-on
length ball, angling in, defended again
worked to leg for a single
full, outside off, pushed down the ground for one
pushed to long-on for another single
length ball, angling in, defended to leg
wide half-volley, crisply driven in front of deep cover for four
that offcutter again, beats Rossouw's attempt to punch
short of a length, outside off, left alone
short of a length, just outside off, defended with an open face
driven square and in the air, one bounce to deep cover
on a length, angling in, worked to deep square for one
full outside off, pushed with an open face to cover
offbreak, tucked away off the pads for one

Tauqir has his reward. He is a lovely genuine offspinner. Puts his body into it, pivots beautifully, and lets the natural variation do the job for him. This one is slow in the air, on a length, just outside off, Rossouw is early into it, plays with hard hands, offers a simple return catch to Tauqir. Slightest bit of turn there. South Africa in a spot of bother here
defended to leg
pushed past point for one
low full toss, clipped away for a couple in front of deep midwicket
drives this on the up and against the turn, finds cover-point
short of a length, outside off, punched to deep point
on a length, on off, defended from the crease
on a length, into the pads, worked away for one
on a length, just outside off, defended to cover
defended to cover
clipped away off the pads, past midwicket
flighted outside off, defended off the front foot
soft hands, defended towards short cover, and they steal a single
tossed up outside off, driven to long-on
flatter, into the pads, worked around the corner
driven to long-off for one

Haider has missed the run-out, or does he get it on the second grab? No he hasn't. For the second time this over, Miller wants a single after pushing one straight to short cover. De Villiers doesn't go this time, Miller slips while turning back, and is gone for all money. The throw, though, reaches Haider on a half-volley, and he fumbles the take, allowing Miller time to get back in. Actually this throw is a low full toss
length ball, swinging in, worked to leg for one

big shout for lbw, but this time they are not reviewing. Steve Davis has saved de Villiers, but this time they don't review it. What a big decision to not review it. Full inswinger, gentle pace, beats the inside edge, hits the front pad, then the back pad. That could have sounded like bat onto pad. No other reason to not give this. Oh UAE, why didn't you review this? It is plumb. Sunny Gavaskar on comms says, "Davis loves to watch AB bat." Oh hello, the Hawkeye stands firmly behind the umpire. Shows it is clipping leg. That projection beats me, though. In the end, a good decision to not review it, but I am sure this was given not-out because of two sounds
driven past cover for one
tucked away for one
a single down the ground
driven straight of long-off
De Villiers opens up. Takes an offbreak from outside off, stays inside the line, goes over extra cover for a six. Lovely drive
pushed to long-off for one
driven down to long-on for one
cut away powerfully but can't beat cover-point
pushed down the ground, but a dive from short straight midwicket saves the single
pushed back to the bowler
full, outside off, driven to long-off
full, swinging in, pushed to midwicket
moves across the line of the ball to sweep it fine of deep square for a couple
inswinger again, gets an inside edge onto the pad. The lack of Alhasmi's pace and the slight inswing is troubling them a little, in that it is difficult to time them
wide length ball this time, pushed to cover
full, just outside off, driven to long-off
short, outside off, punched away to deep cover
middle and leg as it turns back in, played wide of deep midwicket for a couple
defended back to the bowler
pushed to long-on for one
short of a length, angling in, punched down to long-on
flighted on leg, clipped away for a single
short of a length, wide, punched away for a single
tucked away past midwicket for one
length ball outside off, drops it at his toes and steals a single
driven to long-on for one
wide length ball, driven on the up, but straight to extra cover
on a length, outside off, shaping in a little, defended
short, wide, cut away for a single
turning into the pads, worked away for one
worked into the leg side for one
pushed to long-on for one
punched away to deep cover
looks for a single to long-on, ends up hitting this back to Tauqir
dropped. Driven uppishly towards short cover, Tauqir is lazy in his attempt to his left. Goes one-handed when he could have gone with two
gets a leading edge towards long-off
short, wide, cut away, gets a single to deep cover
length ball, on the pads, clipped away past midwicket
pushed to short straight midwicket
drives on the up, but finds short cover
on a length, on off, no turn, concedes a single off the inside half of the bat
driven to long-on
down the wicket, right to its pitch, drives this to long-on
slightly short, he goes back, punches, but can't beat cover
tossed up, hit back to Tauqir
pushed back to the bowler - just before this ball AB didn't seem happy about something
on a length, on off, defended to cover
full swinging delivery, hit back at him
full inswinger again, played straight to midwicket
drives this to long-off for one
wide length ball, stays on the back foot, gets no timing on this, and defends it back
wide length ball, he stretches out, is on a knee, and then drives it past extra cover
length ball, into the pads, helped away for a single
and Miller, with the lbw ruled out from that angle, sweeps right away and gets four to square leg
full, on off, pushed slightly wide of long-off and comes back for two
pushed through into the pads, defended
slightly short, punched to long-on for one
that ends Tauqir's excellent spell. Pushed to long-on for one
inswinger off target, starts too straight, and AB tickles it fine of short fine leg for four
uppishly played towards short midwicket as the ball is too slow for him
wide length ball, pushed to long-off for one
driven on the up, but finds short extra cover
full, dipping inswinger, mistimes this push to cover
another delivery too straight, and he has nudged this square of short fine for four more. South Africa getting a move on now
on a length, on off, he stays beside the line, makes room by arching back, and drives this between cover and extra cover. Top shot manufactured out of nothing
on a length, angling in, worked to leg for one
bunts this flat delivery into the leg side for one
looks to make room, Khurram bowls accurately, he pushes this to long-off for one
punched down to long-on for one
makes room to drive this from outside leg to long-off
short of a length, outside off, pushed to cover
into the pads once again with short fin leg up. Deflected square of that man. Yet another fifty for de Villiers
short of a length, swinging in, punched back to him
length ball, swinging in, driven to long-on for one
low full toss, driven to long-off
short of a length, into the pads, punched away for one
driven to long-on for one
short of a length, punched down to long-on
backs away, comes back to his normal stance, gets a single to long-on
driven to long-on for another single, Hundred for this stand
makes room to drive this to long-on
down the wicket to get a single to long-on
on a length, pushes this to long-off for one

short of a length, swinging back in, punched to long-off. Alhashmi looks to field to his left, and seems to have done something to his knee in the process. He wants to stick a foot out to field, but the foot lands awkwardly. Has done either the ankle or the knee
pushed to long-on for one
full, off, driven to long-off
driven down to long-on
swept away for a single
goes full and wide, bowls too wide. He might have hit it, but it is called a wide
bowled'im. UAE doing well. Avoiding records. Rolls his fingers. Short of a length. Miller tries to pull, gets a bottom edge onto the stumps. Misses out on a fifty
length ball, angling across, left alone
on a length, on off, defended from the crease
short of a length, outside off, steered away to third man
steered down to third man for another single
full, outside off, pushed to mid-off
on a length, straight, gets a single to long-on
short of a length, angling in, drops with soft hands for a single
full and straight, hits into the feet of the bowlers, takes a single off the deflection
steered away for one

dropped. Clear signs this pitch is slow. De Villiers looks to go down the ground, mistimes it back at Javed who sticks a hand out. His first reaction is preservation, then he realises it is coming slowly. Too late
and now de Villiers gets into the mood. Gets another gentle length ball, and plays a pick-up shot over midwicket for six
pushed straight to cover
on a length, outside off, driven straight to cover again
mistimed towards mid-on for one
on a length, just outside off, and he has driven it back over his outstretched arms
length again, and AB makes room to drive this square over point
nearly a yorker, driven wide of cover-point for one
full toss on the pads. AB stands absolutely still and lets the wrists do all the work in this pick-up shot over square leg
lucky to get away with this one. Bowls full and on the pads. De Villiers gets only an inside edge for a single
steers this to third man to let de Villiers have the strike
full, just outside off, he opens up his body by clearing the front leg and drives this over extra cover for four
full, swinging in, dug out for a single to short fine leg
short of a length, angling in, Duminy gets a single to third man
on a length, looks to drive this into the off side, finds cover
pushed to mid-off for one
on a length, hit back to Shahzad
slower ball, hit down to long-on for one
full outswinger, gets an inside edge onto the pad
this is a wide half-volley, and Duminy leans into it to drive it past cover for four
full, on off, driven to long-off for one
short of a length, into the pads, worked away for a single
makes room to drive this to deep cover for one
full, into the pads, turned around the corner
he moves across the stumps to get close to the line of this delivery wide outside off, and then slog-sweeps it over midwicket for a flat six
drives inside-out but can't beat the short straight extra cover
on a length, on the pads, the strike is handed back

he is out for 99. For a change de Villiers doesn't get a hundred. Wide length ball, he opens the face on the drive, ends up slicing it straight to short third man. Walks off with a smile on his face. Raises his bat to the sparse crowd
full toss first ball, punches it straight of mid-on for three
short of a length, tucked around the corner for another single
short of a length, at him, he fends
ungainly pull from outside off, gets a single
spears this in full, dug out for a single
stays back to work a length ball to leg
driven to deep midwicket for one
punched down to long-on for one
pushed towards wide long-on, but can't come back for two
full, on the pads, another single
full, straight, pushed to mid-on for another single
slower ball, on a length, pushed towards mid-on for one
full, on off, dug out for a single to cover
short, that's a long hop, and he has pulled this over midwicket. Absolutely smacked out of his sight
wide length ball, driven to deep cover for one
on the pads, clipped straight to short midwicket
full and straight, nearly a yorker, earns a dot towards mid-on
moves inside the line to work this towards deep midwicket for two
low full toss, nearly a yorker, he risks a single to short midwicket and makes it. No direct hit anyway
wide length ball, driven to deep cover
low full toss, driven to long-on for one
low full toss, hit wide of long-off for a couple
lovely delivery with a 23-over-old ball. This one moves away against the angle, and it beats Behardien's push away from the body
short-arm chip back over the bowler's head for a couple. Haider fields well at long-off, close to the boundary
full and straight, bunted between long-on and deep midwicket for a couple
slogs a length ball across the line, gets it flat over midwicket for four
punched to deep cover for one

given out lbw as he plays across the line of a full ball. This is definitely hitting the stumps, but is it full enough to have pitched within the stumps. Duminy has reviewed this. It is pitching in line, and is full enough to to not angle too far away. Clipping off according to the projection
wide length ball, driven to long-off for a single
driven to long-on to hand the strike over to Behardien
with fine leg up you can't be bowling down the leg side. Nudged away fine of that man for four
full, swinging in, driven to long-on
high full toss, tucked away for a single that brings up the 300. South Africa bemused this hasn't been called a no-ball. Touch and go on weather this waist high
driven to long-on for one
driven to long-on for one
wide length ball, driven with an open face, gets a couple square of third man
slogs this. Old-fashioned ugly slog. The ball goes off the inside half of the bat. Between midwicket and mid-on
yorker, on off, digs it out for a single
wide length ball, he gets stuck into this, lofting it over extra cover for six
low full toss, hit down to long-on for one
full and wide, drilled to long-off for one
low full toss, slugged to long-on for one
high full toss, pulled over square leg for a six. That is called no-ball. The yorker gone wrong

that's a quick fifty for Behardien without attracting too much attention towards himself. Length ball, lofted down the wicket, easy catch if long-on is on the fence, but he is well inside, and has been lobbed. Rihan Mustafa is the man
and now Mustafe drops it. Behardien mis-hits this slower ball, goes up for an easy catch at long-on, and Mustafa drops it
another high full toss, not called a no-ball, but he has cleared midwicket to get four more
full and straight, Behardien makes room, and chips this over extra cover for four more
